nodes.name: auth.signUp
nodes.description: Registers a validated phone number in the system.

nodes.name: auth.signIn
nodes.description: Signs in a user with a validated phone number.

nodes.name: auth.resetAuthorizations
nodes.description: Terminates all user's authorized sessions except for the current one.

nodes.name: auth.exportAuthorization
nodes.description: Returns data for copying authorization to another data-centre.

nodes.name: auth.importAuthorization
nodes.description: Logs in a user using a key transmitted from their native data-centre.

nodes.name: auth.bindTempAuthKey
nodes.description: Binds a temporary authorization key temp_auth_key_id to the permanent authorization key perm_auth_key_id. Each permanent key may only be bound to one temporary key at a time, binding a new temporary key overwrites the previous one.

nodes.name: auth.checkPassword
nodes.description: Try logging to an account protected by a 2FA password.

nodes.name: auth.requestPasswordRecovery
nodes.description: Request recovery code of a 2FA password, only for accounts with a recovery email configured.

nodes.name: auth.recoverPassword
nodes.description: Reset the 2FA password using the recovery code sent using auth.requestPasswordRecovery.

nodes.name: auth.resendCode
nodes.description: Resend the login code via another medium, the phone code type is determined by the return value of the previous auth.sendCode/auth.resendCode: see login for more info.

nodes.name: auth.dropTempAuthKeys
nodes.description: Delete all temporary authorization keys except for the ones specified

nodes.name: auth.exportLoginToken
nodes.description:
Generate a login token, for login via QR code.
The generated login token should be encoded using base64url, then shown as a tg://login?token=base64encodedtoken URL in the QR code.

nodes.name: auth.importLoginToken
nodes.description: Login using a redirected login token, generated in case of DC mismatch during QR code login.

nodes.name: auth.acceptLoginToken
nodes.description: Accept QR code login token, logging in the app that generated it.
